definition[0]: to understand how serious or important a situation or problem is or what someone’s feelings are
example[0]: He did not fully appreciate the significance of signing the contract.
example[1]: We appreciate that caring for children is an important job.
example[2]: It is difficult to appreciate how bad the situation had become.
definition[1]: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done
example[3]: Thanks ever so much for your help, I really appreciate it.
example[4]: I appreciate your concern, but honestly, I’m fine.
example[5]: I’d appreciate it if you let me get on with my job.
definition[2]: to understand how good or useful someone or something is
example[6]: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.
example[7]: I’m not an expert, but I appreciate fine works of art.
definition[3]: to gradually become more valuable over a period of time
example[8]: Most investments are expected to appreciate at a steady rate.

example[12]: The value of his work is still appreciating
example[13]: Their art collection has appreciated substantially, almost doubling in value.
definition[5]: when a currency appreciates, it increases in value compared to other currencies
example[14]: The Egyptian pound has appreciated against other currencies, and this is not good for Egyptian exporters.
